name: New Balance 992 MiUSA Joe Freshgoods Aged Well

details.description:
The New Balance 992 MiUSA Joe Freshgoods Aged Well is a running shoe-style sneaker with an overlaid suede upper in Rose Smoke and Misty Rose, muted shades of orange and pink, over gray mesh. New Balance branding and Joe Freshgoods’ JFG logo accent the tongue and rear heel, highlighted by USA and N branding on the sides. The color-blocked midsole continues the Aged Well color palette, and a black outsole finishes the shoe.

American sneaker brand New Balance has been based in Massachusetts since 1906, quietly and steadily producing performance-focused shoes. Hailing from Chicago, Joe Freshgoods is a lifestyle clothing brand known for bold, expressive graphics and creative outlets like films. Teaming up with New Balance, Joe Freshgoods applied their Aged Well motif to the 992 MiUSA.

In our opinion, the best feature of the 992 MiUSA Aged Well is its color palette, which presents a new spin on neutrals. The New Balance 992 MiUSA Joe Freshgoods Aged Well was released on February 28, 2025, and retailed for $220.

name: New Balance 992 MiUSA Grey Silver Metallic
New Balance 992 MiUSA Kith Osaka Pack

details.description:
A premium, ‘chef’s kiss’ of a sneaker, the New Balance 992 Miusa Kith Osaka Pack is a chunky, powerhouse of a shoe combining the collaborative efforts of New Balance and Kith. This Japanese-exclusive, the Osaka Pack, is a collector’s dream come true.

The perfect lifestyle shoe, these New Balance X Kith kicks bring fashion and form to the foreground. The 992 is a highly popular silhouette, and this variant brings suede, leather and mesh textiles together in a soft green, grey with beige hints color palette. The sole has traditional ENCAP and ABZORB cushioning to give the perfect support, while the sides are branded with the standard ‘N’ for New Balance and Kith logos.

We love the beauty of this New Balance and Kith collaboration. As two primary streetwear brand, the seamless integration of their craftmanship and flair makes for one good-looking shoe. The New Balance 992 Miusa Kith Osaka Pack was released on March 21, 2025, priced at $210.

name: New Balance 992 MiUSA Teddy Santis Moonrock Mushroom

details.description:
Originally released in 2006 to celebrate the brand’s 100th anniversary, the New Balance 992 Grey was the first New Balance shoe to incorporate ABZORB stability technology. The shoe, which was designed by Jonathan Bacon, was crafted to offer support and comfort for either casual daily wear or athletic activities such as running.

The New Balance 992 Grey is made with suede and mesh uppers, which offer both support and a snug fit as well as plenty of airflow. The ABZORB cushioning material, found in the sole and heel of the shoe, is designed to absorb impact, reducing stress on the joints.

The New Balance 992 grey released in February of 2006 and retailed for $175.

The New Balance 992 JJJJound Grey comes in a brown and black colorway.

The New Balance 992 JJJJound adopts the classic silhouette portrayed in a black and cream colorway. The shoe's upper is constructed from suede and mesh, and the heel features a faint JJJJound insignia. The midsole is made using New Balance's distinctive ABZORB cushioning technology, which ensures comfortable and supportive wear by absorbing impacts and providing cushioning. The outsole is comprised of durable rubber that offers grip and stability.

The New Balance 992 JJJJound Grey was released on August 7th, 2020, for a retail price of $260.

The New Balance 992 Black Blue Grey comes in a black, blue, and grey color scheme.

The New Balance 992 Black Blue Grey features an upper composed of black leather and mesh with blue suede toe protection, light grey sidewalls, and a black and grey heel counter. The shoe features a rubber outsole for grip and durability. The lightweight EVA midsole provides impact absorption and cushioning. Additionally, the shoe features ABZORB cushioning technology on the heel. The sneaker's design is completed with an N insignia on the side and New Balance lettering on the tongue and heel.

The New Balance 992 Black Blue Grey was made available on November 20th, 2021, and retailed for $175.

name: New Balance 992 MiUSA Blue Silver Metallic

details.description:
The New Balance 992 MiUSA Blue Silver Metallic is a sneaker dressed in blue and silver metallic hues. 

The upper of this New Balance 992, which adopts a traditional material construction, is built of mesh and suede and is colored in tones of green and blue. White laces, grey heel tabs, and grey inner liners contrast with the brightly colored upper. The side panels feature navy "N" insignia with silver outlining. Midsoles with a green and white gradient and navy rubber outsoles round off the design.

The  New Balance 992 MiUSA Blue Silver Metallic was released on 5th August 2021 and retailed at $175.

The New Balance 992 Yellow Grey features a yellow and grey leather, pigskin, suede, and mesh upper with subtle grey tones running throughout the silhouette and intertwining with the bottom layer of yellow mesh for the base. From there, a grey New Balance logo and a two-toned midsole with white and grey shades featuring ABZORB technology complete the design.

The New Balance 992 Yellow Grey released in June of 2020 and retailed for $175.

name: New Balance 992 Concepts Low Hanging Fruit

details.description:
Boston-based boutique CONCEPTS and New Balance joined forces to honor pioneering fruit seller Frieda Rapoport Caplan, also known as the "Kiwi Queen", with the New Balance 992 Low Hanging Fruit.

In the 1990s, the entrepreneurial spirit of Frieda Rapoport Caplan helped the kiwi become the most celebrated exotic commercial fruit. In commemoration of this history, the New Balance 992 Low Hanging Fruit takes cues from the kiwi with its hairy brown suede upper with hits of neon green. A strawberry graphic foot bed nods to the intertwining relationship of the two fruits.

The New Balance 992 Low Hanging Fruit released in November of 2021 and retailed for $240.

DISALCAIMER: Please note that the majority of these shoes come in the normal New Balance MiUSA box an not the Concepts special box. Special boxes are only guaranteed on product pages that specifically note "Special Box" in the product name.
